abstract: A configuration type that specifies the preferences and behaviors of a webpage.
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/webkit/webpage/configuration
crawled: 2025-12-08T01:03:28Z
---

# WebPage.Configuration

**Structure**

A configuration type that specifies the preferences and behaviors of a webpage.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor struct Configuration
```

## Initializers

- **init()**: Creates a new configuration value.

## Instance Properties

- **allowsAirPlayForMediaPlayback**: Indicates whether the webpage allows media playback over AirPlay.
- **allowsInlinePredictions**: Indicates whether inline predictions are allowed.
- **applicationNameForUserAgent**: The app name that appears in the user agent string.
- **dataDetectorTypes**: The types of data detectors to apply to the webpage’s content.
- **defaultNavigationPreferences**: The default preferences to use when loading and rendering content.
- **deviceSensorAuthorization**: Allows specifying how web resources may access device sensors.
- **ignoresViewportScaleLimits**: Determines whether a webpage allows scaling of the webpage.
- **limitsNavigationsToAppBoundDomains**: Indicates whether the web view limits navigation to pages within the app’s domain.
- **loadsSubresources**: Indicates whether the webpage loads all of its subresources in addition to the main resource.
- **mediaPlaybackBehavior**: Indicates whether HTML5 videos play inline or use the native full-screen controller.
- **showsSystemScreenTimeBlockingView**: Indicates whether the webpage should use the system Screen Time blocking view.
- **supportsAdaptiveImageGlyph**: Indicates whether insertion of adaptive image glyphs is allowed.
- **suppressesIncrementalRendering**: Indicates whether the web view suppresses content rendering until the content is fully loaded into memory.
- **upgradeKnownHostsToHTTPS**: Indicates whether the web view should automatically upgrade supported HTTP requests to HTTPS.
- **urlSchemeHandlers**: Allows registering an object to load resources associated with a specified URL scheme.
- **userContentController**: The object that coordinates interactions between your app’s native code and the webpage’s scripts and other content.
- **userInterfaceDirectionPolicy**: The directionality of user interface elements.
- **webExtensionController**: The web extension controller to associate with the webpage.
- **websiteDataStore**: The object you use to get and set the site’s cookies and to track the cached data objects.

## Enumerations

- **WebPage.Configuration.MediaPlaybackBehavior**: The behavior used when playing HTML video within a page.

## Configuring a WebPage

- **WebPage.DeviceSensorAuthorization**: A type that describes the authorization permissions policy for the device’s sensors a web resource may access.
- **URLScheme**: A type representing a valid URL scheme.
- **URLSchemeHandler**: A protocol for loading resources with URL schemes that WebKit doesn’t handle.
- **URLSchemeTaskResult**: A value used as part of a sequence of results from a [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/URLSchemeHandler], which can either be a `Data` or a `URLResponse`.

## Conforms To

- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
